Package edu.cornell.gdiac.json.enemies

Class Enemy

java.lang.Object
edu.cornell.gdiac.physics.obstacle.Obstacle
edu.cornell.gdiac.physics.obstacle.SimpleObstacle
edu.cornell.gdiac.physics.obstacle.CapsuleObstacle
edu.cornell.gdiac.json.enemies.Enemy
Direct Known Subclasses:
MovingEnemy, StationaryEnemy
public abstract class Enemy extends CapsuleObstacle
Abstract enemy class.

Initialization is done by reading the json Note, enemies can only be initiated as stationary or moving enemies

  • Method Details

    • getMovement

      public float getMovement()
      Returns left/right movement of this character.

      This is the result of input times dude force.

      Returns:
      left/right movement of this character.

    • setMovement

      public void setMovement(float value)
      Sets left/right movement of this character.

      This is the result of input times dude force.

      Parameters:
      value - left/right movement of this character.

    • getForce

      public float getForce()
      Returns how much force to apply to get the dude moving

      Multiply this by the input to get the movement value.

      Returns:
      how much force to apply to get the dude moving

    • setForce

      public void setForce(float value)
      Sets how much force to apply to get the dude moving

      Multiply this by the input to get the movement value.

      Parameters:
      value - how much force to apply to get the dude moving

    • getMaxSpeed

      public float getMaxSpeed()
      Returns the upper limit on dude left-right movement.

      This does NOT apply to vertical movement.

      Returns:
      the upper limit on dude left-right movement.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(AssetDirectory directory, com.badlogic.gdx.utils.JsonValue json)
      Initializes the dude via the given JSON value

      The JSON value has been parsed and is part of a bigger level file. However, this JSON value is limited to the dude subtree

      Parameters:
      directory - the asset manager
      json - the JSON subtree defining the dude

      public boolean activatePhysics(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.World world)
      Creates the physics Body(s) for this object, adding them to the world. This method overrides the base method to keep your ship from spinning.
